snippet: A forensics report said that taking into account analytical limitations, its findings “moderately support the proposition” that Yasir Arafat’s death was the consequence of polonium poisoning.
abstract: Swiss scientists post forensics report that lends support to theory that Yasir Arafat, symbol of Palestinian national struggle, died of poisoning with radioactive polonium-210; findings, which take into account analytical limitations, come after nine years of mystery and intrigue surrounding Arafat's death.

byline.contributor: Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris, and Said Ghazali from Nablus, West Bank.

lead_paragraph: A forensics report said that taking into account analytical limitations, its findings “moderately support the proposition” that Yasir Arafat’s death was the consequence of polonium poisoning.

headline.main: Swiss Report Supports Theory Arafat Was Poisoned
headline.print_headline: Swiss Report Supports Theory Arafat Was Poisoned
